therapy_1: ^"So, when you were picking out gifts, what was on your mind?"
^"I was really trying to impress her."
^"I wasn’t sure what the right choice was."
i_grabbed_what_i_liked: ^"Honestly? I wasn’t really thinking. I just grabbed what looked good to me."

^"It’s easy to make choices based on what feels good in the moment. But relationships aren’t just about individual wants. Were there other times where you made a decision thinking only about yourself?"
i_was_trying_to_impress_her: ^"I remember being nervous. Like, really nervous. I wanted to get it right. I wanted her to like what I picked."
^"Yeah, well… I probably played it off like I was just goofing around. But I cared. I wanted to do it right."
^"It’s interesting how much effort we put in at the beginning of relationships. The small ways we try to show love. Do you feel like that effort has faded over time?"
i_wasnt_sure_what_the_right_choice_was: ^"I remember overthinking everything. Like… what if I picked something weird? What if she thought I was trying too hard? Or not enough?"
^"I mean, I do that too. With different things, but… yeah."
^"Uncertainty is normal. But hesitation can keep us from fully showing up for the people we care about. Do either of you feel like you still hold back?"
carnival_ending: ^"It sounds like that night wasn’t just about the scavenger hunt...it was about how you both showed up for each other. Maybe that’s something to think about. How you bring that effort, that attention, into your relationship now."
^"Yeah. I miss that. The laughing, the bantering... I think I forgot how much I loved it."
^"Me too. Maybe we should try it again sometime."
subway_scene: ^"But now, let’s shift gears. Let’s explore a more challenging moment like the argument about your living situation. Peggy, why don’t you walk us through that memory?"
